title: What can science teach us about the benefits of religion? With David DeSteno, PhD
itunes:title: What can science teach us about the benefits of religion? With David DeSteno, PhD
description: For thousands of years, people have turned to religion to answer questions about how to lead a happy, moral and fulfilling life. David DeSteno, PhD, a psychology professor at Northeastern University and author of the book “How God Works,” discusses how the structures and traditions of religion contribute to people’s well-being, what behavioral scientists can learn from studying religion, and how those lessons can be applied outside the context of religious belief.
